title: Congress to the Kurdish Rescue
text:
President Trump hailed a “cease-fire” agreement with Turkey regarding Syria’s Kurds on Thursday as a win for the diplomatic ages, thanking Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan with his usual restraint as “a hell of a leader. And he’s a tough man. He’s a strong man. And he did the right thing.” It’s more accurate to say Mr. Erdogan is looking down the barrel of serious bipartisan economic sanctions from the U.S. Congress.

The deal is a temporary suspension-of-force promise, not a permanent cease-fire. In talks in Ankara with...
description: A Senate sanctions bill has Erdogan’s attention—and Trump’s.
